name: ChromeInputIme
comment: Use the chrome.input.ime API to implement a custom IME for Chrome OS. This allows your extension to handle keystrokes, set the composition, and manage the candidate window.

onActivate.name: onActivate
onActivate.comment: This event is sent when an IME is activated. It signals that the IME will be receiving onKeyPress events.

onDeactivated.name: onDeactivated
onDeactivated.comment: This event is sent when an IME is deactivated. It signals that the IME will no longer be receiving onKeyPress events.

onFocus.name: onFocus
onFocus.comment: This event is sent when focus enters a text box. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

onBlur.name: onBlur
onBlur.comment: This event is sent when focus leaves a text box. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

onInputContextUpdate.name: onInputContextUpdate
onInputContextUpdate.comment: This event is sent when the properties of the current InputContext change, such as the the type. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

onKeyEvent.name: onKeyEvent
onKeyEvent.comment: This event is sent if this extension owns the active IME.

onCandidateClicked.name: onCandidateClicked
onCandidateClicked.comment: This event is sent if this extension owns the active IME.

onMenuItemActivated.name: onMenuItemActivated
onMenuItemActivated.comment: Called when the user selects a menu item

onSurroundingTextChanged.name: onSurroundingTextChanged
onSurroundingTextChanged.comment: Called when the editable string around caret is changed or when the caret position is moved. The text length is limited to 100 characters for each back and forth direction.

onReset.name: onReset
onReset.comment: This event is sent when chrome terminates ongoing text input session.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

setComposition.name: setComposition
setComposition.comment: Set the current composition. If this extension does not own the active IME, this fails.

clearComposition.name: clearComposition
clearComposition.comment: Clear the current composition. If this extension does not own the active IME, this fails.

commitText.name: commitText
commitText.comment: Commits the provided text to the current input.

setCandidateWindowProperties.name: setCandidateWindowProperties
setCandidateWindowProperties.comment: Sets the properties of the candidate window. This fails if the extension doesn’t own the active IME

setCandidates.name: setCandidates
setCandidates.comment: Sets the current candidate list. This fails if this extension doesn’t own the active IME

setCursorPosition.name: setCursorPosition
setCursorPosition.comment: Set the position of the cursor in the candidate window. This is a no-op if this extension does not own the active IME.

setMenuItems.name: setMenuItems
setMenuItems.comment: Adds the provided menu items to the language menu when this IME is active.

updateMenuItems.name: updateMenuItems
updateMenuItems.comment: Updates the state of the MenuItems specified

keyEventHandled.name: keyEventHandled
keyEventHandled.comment:
Indicates that the key event received by onKeyEvent is handled. This should only be called if the onKeyEvent listener is asynchronous.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.keyEventHandled.requestId Request id of the event that was handled. This should come from keyEvent.requestId

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.keyEventHandled.response True if the keystroke was handled, false if not

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeInputIme.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
